avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger is low. On very steep grass-covered slopes, mostly small glide-snow avalanches can trigger naturally.

snowpackStructure.comment: The snowpack was able to settle and consolidate somewhat due to higher temperatures and solar radiation. Particularly on shady slopes in the uppermost part of the snowpack there are weak layers evident which can easily be triggered. During the course of the day, superficially melt-freeze encrusted layers are becoming moist on steep sunny slopes, often wind crusts. On steep sunny slopes a melt-freeze crust is evident. Encrusted snowpack surfaces moisten during the day.

tendency.highlights: Avalanche danger levels are not expected to change significantly.

weatherForecast.comment: Tranquil mountain weather without perturbances from early until late. In the Rhine Valley there is a sea of fog, but the sky is cloudless. Hardly any wind, and not cold. At 2000m: +1 degree. Light winds from northerly directions at high altitudes.

avalancheActivity.comment: In some places avalanches can be triggered by one sole skier, mostly medium-sized releases. Danger zones tend to increase in frequency with ascending altitude, particularly on steep shady slopes, but also behind protruberances in the landscape. Activities in backcountry demand much experience in assessing dangers and defensive conduct. At lower altitudes, danger is moderate. In addition, on very steep grassy slopes, small-to-medium glide-snow avalanches can trigger naturally.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snowdrifts often still prone to triggering at high altitudes

snowpackStructure.comment: The snowpack was able to settle and consolidate somewhat due to higher temperatures and solar radiation. Particularly on shady slopes in the uppermost part of the snowpack there are weak layers evident which can easily be triggered. During the course of the day, superficially melt-freeze encrusted layers are becoming moist on steep sunny slopes, often wind crusts. On steep sunny slopes a melt-freeze crust is evident. Encrusted snowpack surfaces moisten during the day.

tendency.highlights: Avalanche danger levels will decrease further

weatherForecast.comment: Tranquil mountain weather without perturbances from early until late. In the Rhine Valley there is a sea of fog, but the sky is cloudless. Light northerly wind, and not cold. At 2000m: +1 degree. Light winds from variable directions at high altitudes.

Danger zones tend to increase in frequency with ascending altitude, particularly on steep shady slopes, but also behind protruberances in the landscape. Activities in backcountry demand much experience in assessing dangers and defensive conduct. At lower altitudes, danger is moderate. In addition, on very steep grassy slopes, small-to-medium glide-snow avalanches can trigger naturally.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Caution in transitions from shallow to deeper snow

Particularly on shady slopes in the uppermost part of the snowpack there are weak layers evident which can easily be triggered. During the course of the day, superficially melt-freeze encrusted layers are becoming moist on steep sunny slopes, often wind crusts. On steep sunny slopes a melt-freeze crust is evident. Encrusted snowpack surfaces moisten during the day.

tendency.highlights: Avalanche danger levels will decrease further

weatherForecast.comment: Tranquil mountain weather without perturbances from early until late. In the Rhine Valley there is a sea of fog, but the sky is cloudless. Hardly any wind, and not cold. At 2000m: 0 degrees. Light winds from variable directions at high altitudes.

customData.generalHeadline: Considerable avalanche danger regionally at high altitudes
